narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study?
comments: Alan followed his syllabus as closely as possible and was able to cover most if not all that was proposed at the beginning of the term. I do wish that more time had been allotted for the study of contemporary designs and ancient Eastern theater design (Chinese/Japanese/Indian/etc) but understand the limitations of a semester-long survey course.
I wish I could take this class twice!

It gives a really nice overview of the way that theatre architecture has evolved in the west and also how classical influences have travelled and adapted for performance requirements over the ages. But it doesn't really touch upon how this has influenced theatre architecture in the eastern hemisphere, the why and the how.

narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework?
How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented?
comments: i felt that sometimes the information and the number of theatres covered were a little too many for a one hour session and it became hard to remember the exact details associated with a particular era. post 1960s-70s the differences kind of merged into one and i found it difficult to track the changes from decade to decade, especially w.r.t. to evolving safety laws.

narratives.question_text: How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course?

comments: the workload felt less which was good, but i did love some of the exercises. the workload can be increased. maybe a couple of more exercises about how evolving safety laws influenced the design. this would help to form a basis of or a review of the theatre consultation class.

narratives.question_text: How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom?
How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic?
If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
How useful was this course in preparing you for production work?
comments: It's not exactly directly applicable but definitely super interesting and could come in handy if ever working in an old-old venue.

narratives.question_text: How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material?
Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
comments: a little more material to cover how western theatre architecture aesthetics have influenced modern performance practices in the eastern hemisphere of the world would be nice. it would also go to show how important it is to understand the basic requirements of this unique sort of buildings, which are exclusive of performance aesthetics.
This class is super interesting and Alan is the perfect instructor. Wish I could take another semester of it.
